page.title: 01General Description
page.content:
The area extends from Harthill Farm in the south to the tip of Keig Village in the north and is bisected by the B992, Whitehouse/Keig road. The River Don loops from SW to NE and is crossed by a road bridge (built 1817) half a mile from Keig.
It is an excellent farming area where apart from the small farms of Burnside, Meiklehaugh, Bandley and Mill of Bandley, all the land is owned by Forbes Estate and rented to Harthill Farms Partnership. All woodland plantations are owned by Forbes Estate which also operates a small sawmill near Keig village.
